alert.note: Alert for Shasta; Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 4:56PM PDT until August 19 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McFarland burn scar in... Southwestern Shasta County in northern California... West Central Tehama County in northern California... * Until 900 PM PDT. * At 456 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McFarland Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flows. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McFarland Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the McFarland Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Platina. * Additional locations include... South and west of Highway 36 at Beegum to the Trinity County line including the western slopes of Sugarloaf Mountain and the campgrounds at North Beegum Creek, Beegum Gorge and Basin Gulch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life-threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the McFarland Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry areas is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
